comments.body: is it possible to share this code between ansi and non-ansi?
Yes and no. Here is for binary comparison, while in ANSI mode it is for binary operators...It is hard to create a function name for this.
This is needed for a test case with mixed `Date` & `TimestampNTZ` partition columns

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +868,872 @@        Some(TimestampType)

      case (_: TimestampNTZType, _: DateType) | (_: DateType, _: TimestampNTZType) =>
        Some(TimestampNTZType)

@@ -1,1 +962,966 @@      // Implicit cast between date time types
      case (DateType, TimestampType) => TimestampType
      case (DateType, AnyTimestampType) => AnyTimestampType.defaultConcreteType
      case (TimestampType | TimestampWithoutTZType, DateType) => DateType

comments.body: Here the result is the same if casting both to `TimestampWithoutTZType` or `TimestampType`.  Casting to TimestampWithoutTZType is more straightforward.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +640,644 @@      case s @ SubtractTimestamps(AnyTimestampType(), AnyTimestampType(), _, _)
        if s.left.dataType != s.right.dataType =>
        val newLeft = castIfNotSameType(s.left, TimestampWithoutTZType)
        val newRight = castIfNotSameType(s.right, TimestampWithoutTZType)
        s.copy(left = newLeft, right = newRight)

comments.body: I will address this in the PR for extracting date fields.

      case (DateType, TimestampType) => TimestampType
      case (DateType, AnyTimestampType) => TimestampType
      case (TimestampType, DateType) => DateType
